tn.text: "There were twenty two thousand six hundred men"
six thousand troops for battle** - "36,000 soldiers who were ready for battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Listed in their clan lists were 17,200
tn.text: "The clan lists contained seventeen thousand two hundred" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This refers to a person from Aram, a region of Syria.

tn.ref: Ezer and Elead were killed by men of Gath, natives in the land
tn.text: AT: "Men of Gath, the natives in the land, killed Ezer and Elead"

tn.ref: they went to steal their cattle
tn.text: AT: "the brothers went to steal the cattle from the people of Gath"

tn.ref: She conceived and bore a son
tn.text: "She became pregnant and gave birth to a son"

tn.ref: Upper Beth Horon and Uzzen Sheerah
tn.text: These are the names of places.

tn.ref: In these towns the descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived
tn.text: AT: "The descendants of Joseph, son of Israel, lived in these towns"

tn.ref: There were twenty-six thousand men listed who were fit for military service, according to their numbered lists
tn.text: six thousand men listed who were fit for military service, according to their numbered lists** - AT: "According to the clan records, there were 26,000 men who were able to serve in the military" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
